sentence_text: This paper takes on a very important and highly debated problem in political science, namely estimating parties’ policy positions.
post_sentence: As the author(s) rightly argue early in their paper, coding political texts to estimate parties’ positions through large-scale projects is so costly that researchers are often willing to use any available "off-the-shelf" dataset even if these have been largely discredited in terms of reliability and validity (e.g. Gemenis 2013).
